mcasp_drv.c File Reference

Generic McASP Driver for SYS/BIOS Platform.It uses the EDMA for data transfer. More...

#include <ti/drv/mcasp/mcasp_drv.h>
#include <ti/drv/mcasp/mcasp_osal.h>
#include <ti/drv/mcasp/soc/mcasp_soc.h>
#include <ti/drv/mcasp/include/McaspLocal.h>
#include "string.h"

int32_t mcaspDeleteChan (void *chanp)
 This function is called by the application to close a previously opened channel.it deletes the channel so that it is not available for further transactions. All the allocated resources are freed and the channel will be ready for the "open" operation once again. More...

int32_t mcaspCreateChan (void **chanp, void *devp, Mcasp_chanMode_e mode, void *chanParams, MCASP_TiomCallback cbFxn, void *cbArg)
 Creates a communication channel in specified mode to communicate data between the application and the McASP device instance. This function sets the required hardware configurations for the data transactions.it returns configured channel handle to application. which will be used in all further transactions with the channel. More...

 For the transmit operation, the eDMA channel's destination port is tied to the MCASP DAT port. In case of receive, the eDMA channel's source port is tied to the MCASP DAT port. The source address for transmit eDMA channel and the destination address for the receive eDMA channel are set here. More...

Detailed Description

Generic McASP Driver for SYS/BIOS Platform.It uses the EDMA for data transfer.

(C) Copyright 2008, Texas Instruments, Inc

Version
0.2 [25-06-2008] Added the support for non loop job mode 0.1 [17-06-2008] Created newly.

Function Documentation

void Mcasp_commonDmaCallback ( Mcasp_ChannelHandle  chanHandle,
int32_t  status 
)

This callback processes the next request in queue and disables the channel if the last packet. Triggers application callback if requested upon successful completion of packet processing.

Parameters
chanHandle[IN] McASP channel handle
status[IN] status of DMA transaction
Returns
Nothing
int32_t Mcasp_loadPendedIops ( Mcasp_ChannelObj *  chanHandle)

This function restores the driver to the original state that is it resumes the normal operation of the driver by picking the IOPs from the pending queue and putting it to the active IOP.

Parameters
chanHandle[IN] Handle to the device instance object
Returns
status MCASP_COMPLETED if no errors, error code otherwise
int32_t Mcasp_localAbortReset ( Mcasp_ChannelHandle  chanHandle)

Aborts all the request queued up with the current channel.

Parameters
chanHandle[IN] Handle to the mcasp channel
Returns

int32_t Mcasp_localConfigRcvSection ( Mcasp_Object *  instHandle,
Mcasp_HwSetupData *const  rcvData 
)

This function configures the format, frame sync, and other params related to the rcv section. Also configures the rcv clk section.

Parameters
instHandle[IN] Handle to the McASP instance
rcvData[IN] Receive related parameters
Returns
MCASP_COMPLETED - Successful completion of read MCASP_EBADARGS - Invalid parameters or Invalid handle

xmtData[IN] data for configuring the TX section
Returns
MCASP_COMPLETED - Successful completion of read MCASP_EBADARGS - Invalid parameters

int32_t Mcasp_localDmaProcessPkt ( void *  chanp,
MCASP_Packet *  ioPacket 
)

For the transmit operation, the eDMA channel's destination port is tied to the MCASP DAT port. In case of receive, the eDMA channel's source port is tied to the MCASP DAT port. The source address for transmit eDMA channel and the destination address for the receive eDMA channel are set here.

Parameters
chanp[IN] Pointer to channel
ioPacket[IN] Pointer to request to be processed
Returns
MCASP_COMPLETED, if the address is set correctly ERROR ID otherwise
void Mcasp_localIsrSwiFxn ( void *  arg0,
void *  arg1 
)

Swi thread which handles the Mcasp module interrupts.

Parameters
arg0[IN] The pointer to the ISR object holds instance pointer.
arg1[IN] unused argument
Returns
None
int32_t Mcasp_localIsValidPacket ( Mcasp_ChannelHandle  chanHandle)

This checks is the next request in queue is data request. If this is an abort request, it calls the appropriate function to deal with it.

Parameters
chanHandle[IN] Handle to the Mcasp Channel
Returns
MCASP_COMPLETED,if request is Recieved/Transmitted completed Mcasp_STATUS_VALID/MCASP_EBADARGS, if request is not completed

int32_t Mcasp_localLpscOff ( const Mcasp_Object *  instHandle)

Mcasp_localLpscOff.

This function is invoked to power off the module.

Parameters
instHandle[IN] Handle to the device instance
Returns
MCASP_COMPLETED in case of success, an ERROR code in case of error.
int32_t Mcasp_localLpscOn ( const Mcasp_Object *  instHandle)

Mcasp_localLpscOn.

This function is invoked to power on the Mcasp peripheral and configure it according to the operating mode. Note that this function uses different functions to power ON the module, depending on whether PWRM is enabled in this driver or NOT

Parameters
instHandle[IN] Handle to the device instance
Returns
MCASP_COMPLETED in case of success, an ERROR code in case of error.

This function resets the bits related to receive in RGBLCTL.

Parameters
hMcasp[IN] Pointer to the Mcasp Hardware info structure
Returns
MCASP_COMPLETED - Successful completion MCASP_EBADARGS - Invalid parameters or Invalid handle

int32_t Mcasp_localSmReset ( Mcasp_ChannelHandle  chanHandle)

Resets the state m/c of the McASP xmt/rcv unit. In case of interrupt driven transactions, this also resets data queued for servicing the MCASP xmt/rcv unit when it is taken out of reset.

Parameters
chanHandle[IN] Handle to the mcasp channel to reset
Returns
MCASP_COMPLETED if successful Error code if unsuccessful
int32_t Mcasp_localSmSet ( Mcasp_ChannelHandle  chanHandle)

This function activates the state machine of the Mcasp transmit and receive sections and enables the edma transfer.

Parameters
chanHandle[IN] Handle to the Mcasp Channel
Returns
MCASP_COMPLETED if successful Error code if unsuccessful

Bool mcaspIsRequestedSerzsFree ( const Mcasp_Object *  instHandle,
void *  params 
)

This function checks if the requested serialisers are free or not.

Parameters
instHandle[IN] pointer to the Mcasp instance object
params[IN] Device parameter structure that supplies data to initialize the McASP
Returns
TRUE if all serializers are free (Mcasp_SerializerStatus_FREE) FALSE if any one of the requested serializer is not free

This function is a ISR function.it will be called when Mcasp receive interrupt is triggered.

Returns
None

This function is the ISR function. This is called when Mcasp0 XMT interrupt is triggered.

Returns
None

int32_t mcaspSetDitMode ( Mcasp_HwHandle  hMcasp,
Bool  ditFlag 
)

This function enables/disables the DIT mode.

Parameters
hMcasp[IN] Handle to the McASP hardware info structure
ditFlag[IN] Value to loaded into the DITCTL register
Returns
MCASP_COMPLETED - Successful completion MCASP_EBADARGS - Invalid parameters or Invalid handle
int32_t mcaspSubmitReq ( Mcasp_ChannelHandle  chanHandle,
MCASP_Packet *  ioPacket 
)

Writes a packet of data to the output channel of the driver This function is called by the IDriver submit function. This function is called with handle to the o/p channel and the pointer to ioRequest structure which takes a set of information need for the IO.

Parameters
chanHandle[IN] Handle to the McASP channel
ioPacket[IN] io request information structure
Returns
MCASP_COMPLETED or Error code
void mcaspUnRegisterInt ( uint16_t  devid,
int32_t  evt,
int32_t  intNum,
int32_t  mode 
)

unregister interrupt handler for the given channel.

Parameters
devid[IN] instance number
evt[IN] The event number
intNum[IN] The interrupt number
mode[IN] input or output
Returns
Nothing
int32_t mcaspValidateBufferConfig ( Mcasp_ChannelHandle  chanHandle,
Mcasp_ChanParams *const  params 
)

This function validates the application specified buffer formats and updates the channel handle with the choosen buffer format.

Side effect: This function also update the channel environment variable "noOfSlots" that would be used to compute the EDMA 3 indices.

Parameters
chanHandle[IN] Pointer to channel handle
params[IN] user supplied channel configurations.
Returns
DriverTypes_COMPLETED on sucess else an error code is returned
int32_t mcaspWriteChanStatRam ( Mcasp_HwHandle  hMcasp,
Mcasp_ChStatusRam *const  chanStatRam 
)

This function writes to the Channel status RAM (DITCSRA/B0-5)

Parameters
hMcasp[IN] Handle to the McASP instance
chanStatRam[IN] status to be written
Returns
MCASP_COMPLETED - Successful completion of read MCASP_EBADARGS - Invalid parameters or Invalid handle
int32_t mcaspWriteUserDataRam ( Mcasp_HwHandle  hMcasp,
Mcasp_UserDataRam *const  userDataRam 
)

This function writes to the User Data RAM (DITUDRA/B0-5)

Parameters
hMcasp[IN] pointer to the Mcasp H/W information structure
userDataRam[IN] data to be written
Returns
MCASP_COMPLETED - Successful completion of write MCASP_EBADARGS - Invalid parameters or Invalid handle

Mcasp_HwInfo Mcasp_deviceInstInfo[MCASP_CNT]
